2466054b396284f05e6f6e4e7d3c806d (07:53): One thing I did not understand. If the HTML(5, 6?) features are going to be documented/implemented unversioned, how does this impact website designers? Will the spec provide guidelines for capabilities sniffing/exchange or?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (07:54): there's no change for designers because as far as they are concerned it has always been unversioned
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (07:55): i.e. browsers have always done incremental improvements
2466054b396284f05e6f6e4e7d3c806d (07:56): So basically we stay with capabilities sniffing then.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (07:56): the idea with unversioning it and making incremental improvements is to reduce the gap between reality and spec writing
2466054b396284f05e6f6e4e7d3c806d (07:57): Well, sure, writing a spec in isolation takes time, especially if features get implemented at the final publication of said spec. :)
2466054b396284f05e6f6e4e7d3c806d (07:57): Doesn't help much in the quickly evolving way of web development.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:58): exactly :-)
2466054b396284f05e6f6e4e7d3c806d (07:58): Just wonder if capabilities exchange couldn't be more streamlined in some way.

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:58): btw i've dramatically reduced the MaxClients on whatwg.org (and all the other things in hosts, e.g. acidtests.org, hixie.ch, etc), so hopefully it won't run out of RAM so often anymore
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:58): 2466054b396284f05e6f6e4e7d3c806d: how do you mean?

2466054b396284f05e6f6e4e7d3c806d (07:59): Well, right now it seems only seriously involved people sniff out capabilities. A lot are still stuck with white-/blacklists, then you have those that just build a site without regard to additional features if browser X supports it.
2466054b396284f05e6f6e4e7d3c806d (08:00): Maybe it just needs more documenting to get the larger mass of people to pick it up.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:00): i think most people just do what works in their browser
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:00): not sure we can do much about that
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:00): other than getting the browsers in sync
2466054b396284f05e6f6e4e7d3c806d (08:00): Or maybe my mind is just stuck with SATA drives and such that exchange capabilities to the controller :)
